content.title: Intro
content.content:
1997
Preceded by
1997
1998
Year
1999
Followed by
1999
You may also be looking for Third Age 1998.

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1998.

content.title: January
content.content: 5 - Roverandom, edited by Christina Scull and Wayne G. Hammond, is published in the UK.

content.title: April
content.content:
4 - Tyalie Tyelellieva issue 12 is published.
15 - Roverandom, edited by Christina Scull and Wayne G. Hammond, is published in the US.
27 - Actor Godfrey Kenton dies.

content.title: June
content.content:
3 - Producer William Lawrence Snyder dies.
? - CarolinaCon Regional MECCG Newsletter issue 1 is published.

content.title: July
content.content:
15-20 - Mythcon 29.
17 - Author Paul H. Kocher dies.
21 - The Royal Mail published a new set of stamps, "Magical Worlds: Classic Fantasy Books for Children" with art by Peter Malone. One of the stamps features Bilbo and Smaug.
? - Vinyar Tengwar 39 is published.
? - Parma Eldalamberon issue 12 is published.

content.title: August
content.content: 24 - CarolinaCon Regional MECCG Newsletter issue 2 is published.

content.title: September
content.content:
7 - Elfling is founded.
25-27 - Oxonmoot 1998.
? - CarolinaCon Regional MECCG Newsletter issue 3 is published.

content.title: October
content.content:
3 - Actor Roddy McDowall dies.
5 - Tolkien: Man and Myth is published.
17 - Inkling Colin Hardie dies.

? - An Awfully Big Adventure: J.R.R. Tolkien premieres.
? - Audiobooks of Roverandom and Letters from Father Christmas, read by Derek Jacobi, are released.
? - 1998 Khandlendar compiled by Salman Rushtoes
? - Middle-earth Calendar 1998 (Finnish)
? - Middle-earth: The Balrog card game is released.
? - Christian Mythmakers: C.S. Lewis, Madeleine L'Engle, J.R.R. Tolkien, George MacDonald, G.K. Chesterton, & Others is published.
? - Tolkien Calendar 1999 is released.
Years
1995 1996 1997 1998 1999 2000 2001
